title.narrative: KSE - Economic and Financial Reform Support in Ukraine (2019-2022)
KSE - Stöd till ekonomiska of finansiella reformer i Ukraina (2019-2022)

description.narrative:
Kyiv School of Economics (KSE)
Målet är att bidra till ekonomisk tillväxt, social stabilitet och fattigdomsminskning genom ökad effektivitet, förutsägbarhet, och transparens i ekonomiska flöden i Ukraina. Detta ska uppnås genom att stärka statens förmåga att hantera offentliga medel och privat kapital.
Insatsen är indelat i tre komponenter med det övergripande målet att stärka Ukrainas förmåga att hantera offentliga medel och privat kapital. Målet är att bidra till ökad effektivitet, förutsägbarhet och transparens i ukrainska ekonomiska flöden med syfte att öka den ekonomiska tillväxten och sociala stabiliteten och samtidigt minska fattigdom.
I den första komponenten (”Makroekonomisk stabilitet”) är landets centralbank, National Bank of Ukraine (NBU), den huvudsakliga motparten. NBU:s främsta uppgift är att upprätthålla den makroekonomiska stabiliteten i Ukraina, sänka inflationen och minimera risken för störningar i det ekonomiska systemet. Genom kapacitetsutveckling kommer insatsen att bidra till en förstärkning av NBU:s tillsiktsfunktion och prognosförmåga. Ytterligare aktiviteter inom komponent 1 syftar på att stärka andra relevanta institutioner som exempelvis finansdepartementet, samt - och utbildningsverksamhet för den privata sektorn och allmänheten.
I den andra komponenten (”Offentlig finansförvaltning”) är huvudintressenterna personal på mellannivå inom nyckelutgiftsenheter, samt provinsiella och regionala förvaltningar med ansvar för implementering av statsbudgeten. Genom utbildning, kapacitetsutveckling och utveckling av ett kompetensnätverk kan insatsen ha en positiv inverkan på hela stadsbudgetens effektivitet och ändamålsenlighet.
Den tredje komponenten (”Supportfunktion för ekonomisk reform”) innebär KSE-finansiering för stöd till forskning och annan verksamhet som rundabordssamtal, evenemang och konferenser som fungerar som stöd för de första två komponenterna. Syftet är att ha en begränsad, flexibel facilitet som kan användas vid behov efter godkännande av ambassaden.
Insatsens sammanlagda budget är SEK 10 800 000 . Insatsen avser ingen vidareförmedling av medel.

Kyiv School of Economics (KSE) has applied to the Embassy for a 3-year, multi-component programme 'Economic and Financial Reform Support in Ukraine' from September 2019 - September 2022.
The goal is to contribute to economic growth, social stability and poverty reduction through an increased efficiency, predictability and transparency of financial flows in Ukraine by strengthening the state in its capacity to manage public funds and private capital.
The contribution is divided into three components with the overarching outcome of strengthening Ukraine in its capacity to manage public funds and private capital. The goal is to contribute to increased efficiency, predictability and transparency of financial flows in Ukraine to support economic growth, social stability and poverty reduction.
In component 1 'Macroeconomic Stability' the key stakeholder is the National Bank of Ukraine (NBU), Ukraine's central bank. The NBU's primary task is to maintain macroeconomic stability in Ukraine, lowering inflation and minimising potential shocks to the economic system. Through strategic capacity building at key NBU departments the contribution can substantially strengthening the NBU in its forecasting and oversight role. Further supporting activities in this component are related on strengthening other relevant institutions such as the Ministry of Economy and - Finance as well as advocacy and teaching for the private sector and general public.
In component 2 'Public Finance Management' (PFM) the key stakeholders are mid-level staff at Key Spending Units (KSU's) and oblast and regional administration’s responsible for the implementation of the state budget. Through conducting training, capacity building and developing a network of expertise the contribution can positively impact the efficiency and effectiveness of the entirety of the state budget.
Component 3 'Economic Reform Support Facility' provides KSE funding to support research and other activities such as round-tables, events and conferences supporting components 1 & 2. The purpose is to have a limited flexible facility that can be deployed when required, subject to a ToR and no-objection by the Embassy.
The intervention’s total budget is SEK 10 800 000. There is no other than Sida funding and no forwarding of funds.

The goal is to contribute to economic growth, social stability and poverty reduction through an increased efficiency, predictability and transparency of financial flows in Ukraine by strengthening the state in its capacity to manage public funds and private capital. Outcomes: The Contribution is divided into three components. In component 1 'Macroeconomic Stability' the key stakeholder is the National Bank of Ukraine (NBU), Ukraine's central bank. The NBU's primary task is to maintain macroeconomic stability in Ukraine, lowering inflation and minimising potential shocks to the economic system. Through strategic capacity building at key NBU departments the contribution can substantially strengthening the NBU in its forecasting and oversight role. Further supporting activities are related on strengthening other relevant institutions such as the Ministry of Economy and - Finance as well as advocacy and teaching for the private sector and general public. In component 2 'Public Finance Management' (PFM) the key stakeholders are mid-level staff at Key Spending Units (KSUs) and oblast level administration that are directly responsible for the implementation of the state budget. Through conducting training, capacity building and developing a network of expertise the contribution can potentially affect the efficiency and effectiveness of budget allocations at all levels of the state budget. Mid-level staff have been chosen as in previous trainings it was found senior staff often left their positions after completing the training. One group will be formed from the lecturers of public finance in the state universities providing skills upgrade trainings for the public officials (ToT - teaching of teachers/training of trainers). In component 3) 'Economic Reform Support Facility' KSE will improve the knowledge base and research around components 1 & 2 as well as supporting the creation of a community practice through events and round tables.

participating-org.narrative: Kyiv School of Economics (formerly called EERC/Economics, Education and Research Consortium Inc)
Kyiv School of Economics (formerly called EERC/Economics, Education and Research Consortium Inc)

tag.narrative: 1.4 - By 2030, ensure that all men and women, in particular the poor and the vulnerable, have equal rights to economic resources, as well as access to basic services, ownership and control over land and other forms of property, inheritance, natural resources, appropriate new technology and financial services, including microfinance.

1.4 - Senast 2030 säkerställa att alla män och kvinnor, i synnerhet de fattiga och de utsatta, har lika rätt till ekonomiska resurser, tillgång till grundläggande tjänster, möjlighet att äga och kontrollera mark och andra former av egendom samt tillgång till arv, naturresurser, lämplig ny teknik och finansiella tjänster, inklusive mikrokrediter.

1.b - Create sound policy frameworks at the national, regional and international levels, based on pro-poor and gender-sensitive development strategies, to support accelerated investment in poverty eradication actions.

1.b - Upprätta sunda policyramverk på nationell, regional och internationell nivå på grundval av utvecklingsstrategier som stödjer de fattiga och tar hänsyn till jämställdhetsaspekter, för att stödja ökade investeringar i åtgärder för att avskaffa fattigdom.
12.a - Stödja utvecklingsländerna att stärka sin vetenskapliga och tekniska kapacitet att utvecklas i riktning mot mer hållbara konsumtions- och produktionsmönster.
12.a - Support developing countries to strengthen their scientific and technological capacity to move towards more sustainable patterns of consumption and production.
16.5 - Substantially reduce corruption and bribery in all their forms.
16.5 - Väsentligt minska alla former av korruption och mutor.
16.6 - Bygga upp effektiva och transparenta institutioner med ansvarsutkrävande på alla nivåer.
16.6 - Develop effective, accountable and transparent institutions at all levels.
16.b - Promote and enforce non-discriminatory laws and policies for sustainable development.
16.b - Verka för och genomdriva icke-diskriminerande lagstiftning och politik för en hållbar utveckling.
4.4 - By 2030, substantially increase the number of youth and adults who have relevant skills, including technical and vocational skills, for employment, decent jobs and entrepreneurship.

4.4 - Till 2030 väsentligen öka det antal ungdomar och vuxna som har relevanta färdigheter, däribland tekniska färdigheter och yrkeskunnande, för sysselsättning, anständigt arbete och entreprenörskap.

4.7 - By 2030, ensure that all learners acquire the knowledge and skills needed to promote sustainable development, including, among others, through education for sustainable development and sustainable lifestyles, human rights, gender equality, promotion of a culture of peace and non-violence, global citizenship and appreciation of cultural diversity and of culture’s contribution to sustainable development.

4.7 - Senast 2030 säkerställa att alla studerande får de kunskaper och färdigheter som behövs för att främja en hållbar utveckling, bland annat genom utbildning för hållbar utveckling och hållbara livsstilar, mänskliga rättigheter, jämställdhet, främjande av en kultur av fred, icke-våld och globalt medborgarskap samt värdesättande av kulturell mångfald och kulturens bidrag till hållbar utveckling.

description.narrative:
The target results in Results matrix have been formulated primarily at activity level. The achieved results by year 2 of project implementation are mostly within the targets for all components and described in the last Annual conclusion on performance as of 9 Nov 2021.
In a dialogue with the Embassy and during the Annual meeting 2021 KSE presented the outcome level evidence of results, like:
Component 1. The intended outcome is to develop high quality care in Ukraine, strengthen policy-making capacity of NBU and increase public understanding and trust in public policy actions:
- 4 engaged professors for joint positions at KSE and NBU provided input for discussion on informed solutions in the field of monetary policy during COVID pandemics, how to make more effective the SMEs affordable loans government's program "5-7-9" and other financial stability agenda policies in Ukraine;
- within the promo-seminars on career in public service for students and recent graduates (with a training component on soft skills like presentation techniques etc), 22% of the most active participants mentioned that they were interested in career in the public sector, 100% agreed or partially agreed that they received practical skills needed at their (future) workplaces, 100% agreed or partially agreed that they received information that will be useful for their career development.
Component 2. The intended high level outcome was to develop civil servant's and academia professors competence so that those become change agents in their respective areas/public institutions:
- The examples of the changes brought to the respective professional areas could be that the students presented the graduate papers related to their professional area of work with the suggested solutions applying the knowledge acquired during the course.
- Students also provided examples from their professional life of informal ties acquired between the course participants from different governmental agencies facilitated to a large extent the formal work process.
Component 3. KSE Center for Public Finance and Governance (CPFG) was initiated with current program support and aiming to be a watch-dog for the PFM reforms (in particular in budget area) implemented by the government:
- The regular Center's publications in media regarding PFM issues, participation in public finance spending reviews working groups and other work related to requesting and publicizing information on public finance contributed to better information disclosure on PFM by respective governmental authorities.
- Another example of KSE adopting the donor-supported change is the launch of a PFM course on a commercial basis for a wider public/all interested taught by CPFG experts and invited professors.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
